page.title: 01Ten Miles from any Town
page.content: The area is country, with narrow lanes meandering through hills and dales, with many wooded area, and numerous streams running through quaint villages with thatched cottages built of stone, brick and flint (and some of cob). The major feature in the area is Milton Abbey and School. The population consists mainly of agricultural, retired and commuters. It is rather sad that so many properties are holiday dwellings although there are still people in their 80's who have lied here all there lives. The main night life is centred on the Fox at Ansty, but there is also a community centre at Ansty, converted from what was the old brewery, where a vilage pantomine is produced each year and where there is a thriving lunch club and evening club twice a month for the over 60's.
